doc.previous: The Renaissance artists were not pagans although they admired antiquity and they also kept some ideas and symbols of the medieval past Nicola Pisano c 1220 c 1278 imitated classical forms by portraying scenes from the Bible The Annunciation by Nicola Pisano from the Baptistry at Pisa demonstrates that classical models influenced Italian art before the Renaissance took root as a literary movement 56
doc.after: The rediscovery of ancient texts and the invention of printing democratized learning and allowed a faster propagation of ideas In the first period of Italian Renaissance humanists favoured the study of humanities over natural philosophy or applied mathematics And their reverence for classical sources further enshrined the Aristotelian and Ptolemaic views of the universe
